definition: to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)

sentences.english: Laureen approves her husband's political views and once canvassed for him.
sentences.chinese: 她贊同丈夫的政治觀點，並親自開車上陣爲丈夫助選。

sentences.english: But Turner got some help from former New York City mayor Ed Koch.
sentences.chinese: 紐約市前市長考奇也特別出來給特納助選。

sentences.english: The Bush campaign artfully dawdled, then took issue with the debate format.
sentences.chinese: 布什助選團巧妙地拖延，然後對辯論形式提出異議。

sentences.english: After some hesitation,he jumped aboard and contributed to the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 他在猶豫了一陣之後最終參加了助選，捐了一些錢。

definition: (Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
lit. cries of complaint fill the roads (idiom); complaints rise all around/discontent is openly voiced
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
Frank Chang-ting Hsieh (1946-), Taiwanese DPP politician, mayor of Kaohsiung 1998-2005
